import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from io import BytesIO
from PIL import Image

# Assuming the Titanic dataset is in a CSV file named 'titanic.csv' in your workspace folder
file_path = 'path_to_your_workspace_folder/titanic.csv'

# Read the dataset into a pandas DataFrame
titanic_data = pd.read_csv(file_path)

# Count the number of survivors and non-survivors by gender
survival_by_gender = titanic_data.groupby(['Sex', 'Survived']).size().unstack()

# Create a bar chart
survival_by_gender.plot(kind='bar', color=['red', 'green'])

# Add labels and title
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.title('Survival Counts by Gender in Titanic Dataset')

# Add legend
plt.legend(['Did not survive', 'Survived'])

# Capture the plot as a BytesIO object
image_stream = BytesIO()
plt.savefig(image_stream, format='png')
image_stream.seek(0)

# Create a PIL Image from the BytesIO object
image = Image.open(image_stream)

# Display the image
image.show()

# Optionally, you can close the plot to free up resources
plt.close()
